creditline: Collection of Yvonne and Gabriel P. Weisberg
description: cat. 4; old woman holding a cane; appears to be sitting on step in front of black door; cream edge; beige paper; light brown mat; gold frame with two rows of relief dots; reddish and brown tints on frame
medium: Black and brown chalk on tan laid paper
text: François Bonvin searched for models on the streets of Paris and brought them into his studio so he could make careful studies. He instructed them in a variety of poses and carefully rendered their tattered garments. It has been suggested that a young James McNeill Whistler saw this drawing of an old woman leaning wearily on her cane in Bonvin's studio and adapted her pose for the famous painting of his mother.
title: Seated Old Woman Holding a Cane
